tv.source-info-name: Pluto TV Space guide by TV

programme.title: The New Frontier: Proving Einstein
programme.desc: Some of the proof of Einstein’s theories had long been elusive, beyond the capabilities of technology, until now.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Exo Planeta
programme.desc: As scientists and astronomers peer closer at nearby stars with ever more fidelity they are discovering planets; exo planets, worlds outside our own solar system.

programme.title: RISING TIDES
programme.desc: The next generation of Earth observation satellites are now in place maintaining the continuity of long-term climate data, in particular the planets rising temperatures and related ocean levels.

programme.title: The Truth is in the Stars
programme.desc: Does our society have the capacity to live up to Star Trek's optimistic vision for humanity's future? William Shatner takes us on a journey to find out whether art has imitated life in the years since the world-renowned TV series premiered in 1966.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Vesta Unveiled
programme.desc: With the Dawn missions exploration of the asteroid Vesta and the dwarf planet Ceres, asteroids are a hot topic. See what these incredible missions have uncovered.

programme.title: The Fabric of the Cosmos: The Illusion of Time
programme.desc: Brian Greene takes us on the ultimate time traveling adventure, hurtling 50 years into the future before stepping into a wormhole to travel back to Big Bang.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Astronauts
programme.desc: One hundred kilometres above the Earth’s surface lies an invisible frontier: the edge of space.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Martian Attractions
programme.desc: The Latest in Martian exploration from orbit and on the ground, new sources of water and planetary dust storms are a few of the stories unfolding on to the Red Planet.

programme.title: Spacetime: Gravity – The force that holds everything together
programme.desc: The force of gravity. Nothing and no one can escape from it. This mysterious power surrounds and permeates us. Gravitation determines our life on earth, holds the universe together and is the key to understanding the universe.

programme.title: The New Frontier: GIANTS IN THE DARK
programme.desc: Asteroids, the debris from the early solar system hold tantalizing clues to planetary formation. The spacecraft Psyche readies to study a unique metallic asteroid.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas
programme.desc: See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Mars: Adapt Or Leave
programme.desc: As the latest successes and failures come and go Mars continues to give up her secrets.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Silent Partner
programme.desc: Although we have put man on the moon, our silent partner still holds many mysteries. What haven't we seen? What haven't we discovered?

programme.title: The New Frontier: Where Are All the Aliens?
programme.desc: We’re looking hard, but the numbers aren’t stacking up, is life on other planets that hard to find? Even signals from an advanced race elude us.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Icy Gems: Frozen Moons
programme.desc: In the far depths of space, out of reach of the Sun's warmth, water can only exist in a super solid state. Some small moons, in fact, are made entirely of ice. What stories do these Icy Gems have to tell about our solar system?

programme.title: The New Frontier: INCREASING ORBIT
programme.desc: The ISS is the workhorse of the international spacefaring community, but its days are numbered. R

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini: Docking and EVA - In the final phase of the Gemini program NASA struggles with docking and spacewalks. Curiosity Roving Mars - On the surface of Mars the Curiosity rover is changing the way we think about the red planet.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Getting There
programme.desc: Launching payloads into space is a very difficult task, historically rocket launches are the proverbial 'swords into ploughshares'.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Mercury Or Bust
programme.desc: The ESA - JAXA joint Bepi-Colombo Mission is moments away from launch.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Fermi Paradox
programme.desc: The Fermi Paradox asks the ultimate question: Given a few reasonable assumptions about the chance of life arising elsewhere in the universe and the distance between the stars, why has an alien civilization not presented itself?

programme.title: The Fabric of the Cosmos: Quantum Leap
programme.desc: Join Brian Greene on a wild ride into the weird realm of quantum physics, which governs the universe on the tiniest of scales.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Inner Worlds
programme.desc: They orbit between us and our Star, the inner worlds; hidden within the sun's glare often only visible at sunrise or sunset.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Galactic Visions: Alien Worlds
programme.desc: The diversity, complexity, and downright beauty of our own solar system is astounding. Could such beauty exist in other parts of the universe as well? Thanks to modern science, we now have the capability to see for ourselves.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Ice Giants
programme.desc: Beyond the asteroid belt lay the ice giants, some can be seen with the naked eye, others only glimpsed once by a passing probe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Milky Way
programme.desc: This episode traces our view of the Milky Way, from the mythology of ancient sky watchers to the efforts of scientists to map it from the inside out.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Giant Planets: Lords of Gravity
programme.desc: Gravity is one of the most basic and powerful forces shaping our universe. Discover its nature within our own solar system, from the smallest moons to the largest planets.

programme.title: Spacetime: Destination Mars - From the moon to the red planet
programme.desc: Mankind is entering a new era of space travel. Astronauts are set to return to the moon before the decade is out. And scientists and visionaries say: humans will soon set foot on a foreign planet for the first time: Mars.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Gravity
programme.desc: LISA pathfinder, has led the way for a space based gravity wave detector, what are gravity waves and why are they so hard to detect?

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini Commences - Did Gemini give the US a lead in the space race? Venus Express - The last days of ESA's Venus probe. EMU - NASA's Extravehicular Mobility Unit. Deep Space Communications - ESA's worldwide network of giant dishes.

programme.title: The New Frontier: OCEANS IN THE SKY
programme.desc: Juice and the Europa Clipper are two missions to our Solar System’s largest planet.
